description:
Server for performing blind docking calculations. Unique approach where user only inputs ligand and protein, and where the whole protein surface area is processed in order to find potential ligand interaction spots. Main application case can be found at:

https://www.nature.com/articles/s41589-019-0278-6
name: Blind Docking Server

metadata.abstract: NLRP3 (NOD-like receptor pyrin domain-containing protein 3) is an innate immune sensor that contributes to the development of different diseases, including monogenic autoinflammatory syndromes, gout, atherosclerosis, and Alzheimer’s disease. The molecule sulfonylurea MCC950 is a NLRP3 inflammasome inhibitor with potential clinical utility. However, the mechanism of action of MCC950 remains unknown. Here, we characterize the mechanism of action of MCC950 in both wild-type and autoinflammatory-related NLRP3 mutants, and demonstrate that MCC950 closes the ‘open’ conformation of active NLRP3.
metadata.title: MCC950 closes the active conformation of NLRP3 to an inactive state
